queries.title: Find Schools
queries.description: Users can search for schools according to specific criteria.  Matches are based on all criteria.

tools.title: About BC Francophonie Map
tools.content:
This map allows you to find francophone resources and services in British Columbia. Five sectors are displayed as layers to allow you to do a search by subject, category and area.From the menu, you can use the map tool to zoom and pan around the map. 

You can focus on one layer or a combination of layers using the "Search by Sector"menu. You can also search for specific locations and services using the"Search by Category" menu or within a specific area under `Find Nearby`. 


    When you see a number in a circle, it represents a cluster of resources. Simply click on the number or zoom in to view.

Once you've found a service, click the marker on the map to get information about the resource and its location. Please note that some locations offer many services, and therefore will show many service markers. 

The search box found above the map allows you to quickly navigate to a specific address, city or geographic feature such as 'Mount Douglas'.

 

Why is some information clustered? 

A cluster indicates that there are multiple sites around the same area.  

Trying to display all the sites would be confusing. Play with the zoom level, to enlarge the area and reduce the cluster from a site with multiple services to an area showing only one building, a block or a municipality.

By clicking on a cluster you will:

1.Enlarge the map. This will either break a cluster into smaller clusters or display the individual points.

2. A cluster with less than 10 sites will display a pop-up information window when you click on the cluster. To select the next choice, click on the Next button at the bottom of the pop-up window until you find the one you are interested in.


Cliquez sur le papillon pour accder la carte.

tools.title: What will I find on the map?

component.template:
The data for each layer is provided by the Provincial organizations immersed in the specific sector. If you would like to be added to the map, please contact the corresponding sector as listed below. The organizations will regularly provide updates to refresh the map.
If you have questions or comments on the current map, please contact the Francophone Affairs Program at FAP@gov.bc.ca.

Early Childhood Care

Data include:
  • Group Child Care
  • Family Child Care
  • Preschools
  • Preschool and Group Child Care
  • Strong Starts Program
Data provided by the Fdration des parents francophones de la C.-B.

Health Professionals
Data include: 
  • Dietitian
  • Holistic Nutritionist
  • Massage Therapist
  • Optician
  • Optometrist
  • Pain Management
  • Physiotherapist
  • Psychologist
  • Radiation
  • Oncology
  • Registered
  • Clinical Counsellor
  • Registered Occupational Therapist
  • Registered Social Worker
  • Speech Therapist

Data provided by Rso-Sant

Service Directory

Data include:
  • Accountants
  • Architects
  • Arts / Graphics / Printing / Promotion
  • Chamber of Commerce
  • Churches
  • Community Centres / Yoga Classes
  • Diplomatic Representations
  • Education; Schools, Preschools and Daycare
  • Employment Services
  • Francophone Association
  • Government
  • Hair Styling and Beauty Parlor
  • Health Services
  • Hospitality
  • Immigrant Services
  • Insurance and Financial Services
  • IT Support Services
  • Lawyers
  • Medias / Communication / Web
  • Nursing Homes
  • Real Estate
  • Restaurant / Catering / Cooking Classes 
  • Tourism
  • Translation
Data provided by the Fdration des francophones de la C.B.


Tourism Sites

Data include:

  • Accommodation
  • Attraction
  • Restaurant
  • Retail Service

Data provided by the Socit de dveloppement conomique de la C.B.

Francophone Schools (K-12)

Data include: 
  • French Immersion Schools
  • Francophone Schools
Core French is a second language program offered at various grade levels, in which French is studied as a subject rather than as a language of instruction. The program enable a learners to communicate purposefully in French and to provide opportunities for students to develop openness to cultural diversity. 

Early French Immersion is a program where French language instruction is offered to students in some subject areas. This program is normally offered to students whose first language is not French. Upon graduation, students will have acquired sufficient language skills to be able to pursue post-secondary studies or work in either official language.

Late Immersion refers to those beginning French Immersion in Grade 6.

Francophone is a program offered to students whose first language is French or who qualify under Section 23 of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms.

Data provided by the Ministry of Education

WorkBC Centres

WorkBC Centres, located throughout the province, offer individualized, in-person help to British Columbians who are looking for work.

WorkBC Centres are accessible, inclusive, and staffed with supportive, knowledgeable people who understand your employment needs. We have a variety of information, services and programs to help you find a job and keep it long-term.

Acknowledgments:

The Francophone Affairs Program would like to thank their partners in the creation of this map:
